paragraphs.text: For Winemaker, Robin Akhurst - a native of Scotland, the road to Napa took him around the globe, through eight consecutive and exhausting harvests, from Marlborough, New Zealand, Barossa Valley, Australia and Puligny-Montrachet, France. Robin’s winemaking beliefs are simple: to produce a wine that has balance, purity and an expressive character. He strives to make wines that are to be enjoyed among friends and on the dinner table with family.

Internationally-acclaimed architecture and a commitment to estate-grown Napa Valley wines make Clos Pegase one of the most distinctive wineries in the world. With nearly 300 acres of estate vineyards, a Michael Graves-designed winery, a state-of-the-art winemaking facility and a newly-planted Heritage Garden landscape, Clos Pegase is a celebration of Napa Valley wine and a landmark destination.

Mitsuko's Vineyard, named for the founder’s late wife, covers 365 rolling acres of the Los Carneros appellation within the Napa Valley. A broad range of soil types, elevations, slopes, and microclimates make up this distinct property. After examining the soil of the vineyard before planting, it was discovered that a section of the land was Haire clay-loam similar to the soils of Bordeaux’s Right Bank, a region famous for making some of the best Merlot in the world. This section of the vineyard was planted to a unique blend of Merlot clones well-suited to this climate.

Exotic and complex this Merlot possesses aromas of blackberry liqueur, cherry pie and violets enhanced by fresh pipe tobacco and spices. Broad fruit flavors are balanced by a round structure and lengthy finish.
